p: Inhibition of α-amylase and α-glucosidase activity was also studied for T. mastichina essential oil, with reported IC 50 values of 4.6 and 0.1 mg/mL, respectively [ 40]. The inhibition of these enzymes could result in the slow and prolonged release of glucose into circulation and, consequently, the retardation of sudden hyperglycemia after the consumption of a meal.
